meanings.definition: A boardwalk made of wooden slats or planks, typically used to provide a dry walking surface over wet or muddy ground.
meanings.sent1: The hikers walked comfortably on the duckboards through the marshy area.
meanings.sent2: The park installed duckboards in the swamp to make it easier for visitors to walk.
meanings.sent3: The ducks thought the duckboards were made just for them to waddle on!
meanings.sent4: The duckboards stretched out like a wooden ribbon over the soggy land.
meanings.sent5: The sound of footsteps echoed on the sturdy duckboards, keeping shoes clean.

meanings.definition: To cover or pave with duckboards.
meanings.sent1: The workers will duckboards the entire path to prevent it from getting muddy.
meanings.sent2: They decided to duckboards the construction site to make it safer for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The team joked that they should duckboards the office floor to avoid spills.
meanings.sent4: She carefully duckboards the area with precision, ensuring a smooth surface.
meanings.sent5: The gardeners will duckboards the garden path to keep it neat and dry.
